</items>     </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/96/blagoevgrad-how-to-create-and-manage-a-digital-archive-the-case-of-daril">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-11-12T22:23:21+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Blagoevgrad: How to Create and Manage a Digital Archive: The Case of DArIL</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/96/blagoevgrad-how-to-create-and-manage-a-digital-archive-the-case-of-daril</link>         <description><p>Tuesday, November 12th, 2013, h. 19.30<br /> Panitza Library Series, American University in Bulgaria (Blagoevgrad,<br /> Bulgaria), Panitza Library<br /> &lt;<a href="http://www.aubg.bg/eventPopup.aspx?eid=2091">http://www.aubg.bg/eventPopup.aspx?eid=2091</a>&gt;<br /> <br /> Book Presentations and Readings Series:<br /> Dr. Marco Forlivesi (University of Padua and University of Chieti - Pescara, Italy)<br /> "How to Create and Manage a Digital Archive: The Case of DArIL (Digital<br /> Archive of Inaugural Lectures at Renaissance and Early Modern Universities)"</p> <p>During the presentation, the public will be informed about the publication on DArIL in Europeana trhough Linked Heritage, thanks to the mediation of the University of Padua, as well as about the training programme developed in the framework of Linked Heritage.</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/95/rotterdam-europeana-network-agm">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-09-05T22:05:09+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Rotterdam: Europeana Network AGM</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/95/rotterdam-europeana-network-agm</link>         <description><p>Europeana is organising the third Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Europeana Network, to be held on 2 December 2013 at <a href="http://www.dedoelen.nl/">De Doelen</a> in Rotterdam. The AGM will take place alongside <a href="http://dish2013.nl/">DISH 2013</a>, the biennial international conference on digital strategies for heritage, on 2 and 3 December in the same venue.</p> <p>The AGM will reflect on the work of the Network and Europeana during the past year and inform and influence the work for the coming years. There will be plenty of time and opportunities for networking and the round table set up in the main hall is ideal for birds of a feather talks or informal / ad hoc meetings. Please take a look at the agenda <a href="http://bit.ly/14XHMmt">http://bit.ly/14XHMmt</a>. The two day DISH conference will be made up of small interactive sessions interspersed with inspiring keynotes talks around three main themes: business for creative industries, active audiences and new competences. Both events are key opportunities to network and to look ahead to the challenges and opportunities facing the cultural sector in the years ahead.</p> <p>Europeana Network members can attend free of charge both the annual general meeting and the reception on the evening of 2 December open for all AGM/ DISH participants. Those who wish to attend the DISH conference can do so at a special discount price of 115 EUR (excl. 7,19 EUR payment processing fee by Eventbrite).</p> <p>Registration: <a href="http://dish2013.eventbrite.nl/">http://dish2013.eventbrite.nl/</a>.</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/94/padova-venetonight-the-european-researchersu2019-night-in-veneto">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-06-10T13:56:05+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Padova: Venetonight - the European researchers%u2019 night in Veneto</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/94/padova-venetonight-the-european-researchersu2019-night-in-veneto</link>         <description><p>The Researchers&rsquo; Night was promoted by the European Commission with the aim of giving citizens the opportunity to meet researchers, reinforcing the relationship between science, school and society and encouraging young people to explore the world of research. Inside this initiative the Library System of the University of Padua presented the Linked Heritage project.<br />Attendees were impressed by the quality of the project. They had not previously realised that libraries and museums were so deeply involved in the digital revolution. Most of them had not yet heard of Europeana!</p> <p>Within the poster session four librarians &ndash; from the University Library System &ndash;presented to the attendees &ndash; Students, citizens, children &ndash; the activities, and goals of the project Linked Heritage. In particular, with the assistance of the poster attached, they were then able to illustrated their work package &ldquo;Dissemination &amp; Training&rdquo; and its relation with Europeana. Furthermore they presented Phaidra, the new digital asset management system with long-term archiving functions of the University of Padua.</p> <p><a href="http://www.venetonight.it/" title="Link to external website">http://www.venetonight.it/</a></p> <p><strong>Outputs</strong><br />See YouTube and Webradio of the overall event:</p> <p><a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2miTfPU5Z9M">http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2miTfPU5Z9M</a></p> <p><a href="http://www.radiobue.it/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=4077:la-ricerca-incontra-la-citta&amp;catid=141:we-top&amp;Itemid=240">http://www.radiobue.it/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=4077:la-ricerca-incontra-la-citta&amp;catid=141:we-top&amp;Itemid=240</a></p> <p><strong>Poster:</strong><br /><a href="../getFile.php?id=118">http://www.linkedheritage.org/getFile.php?id=118</a></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/93/firenze-eva-florence-2011-presentation-of-linked-heritage-in-the-workshop-ten-years-of-networking-for-digital-cultural-heritage">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-06-10T13:48:00+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Firenze: EVA Florence 2011: Presentation of Linked Heritage in the Workshop "Ten years of networking for digital cultural heritage.</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/93/firenze-eva-florence-2011-presentation-of-linked-heritage-in-the-workshop-ten-years-of-networking-for-digital-cultural-heritage</link>         <description><p>The workshop aims at presenting the state of the art and some highlights European projects in the field of digital cultural heritage where the ICCU participates as coordinator or partner: ATHENA, LINKED HERITAGE, Judaica Europeana, ARROW+, and Europeana 14-18 as to digitisation and aggregation of cultural content, and DC-NET and INDICATE as to the e-Infrastructures for the cultural domain within EU and Mediterranean countries.<br /><a href="http://www.otebac.it/index.php?it/22/archivio-eventi/203/firemze-eva-2011-workshop-ten-years-of-networking-for-digital-cultural-heritage">http://www.otebac.it/index.php?it/22/archivio-eventi/203/firemze-eva-2011-workshop-ten-years-of-networking-for-digital-cultural-heritage<br /></a></p> <p><strong>Outputs</strong><br />Linked Heritage PPT presentation by Antonella Fresa.<br /><a href="http://www.otebac.it/getFile.php?id=497">http://www.otebac.it/getFile.php?id=497</a></p> <p><a href="../getFile.php?id=105" title="Link to external website">http://www.linkedheritage.org/getFile.php?id=105</a></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/92/bristol-guest-lecture-part-of-masters-in-information-and-library-management">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-06-10T13:40:39+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Bristol: Guest lecture (part of Masters in Information and Library Management)</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/92/bristol-guest-lecture-part-of-masters-in-information-and-library-management</link>         <description><p><strong>Goal:</strong> To introduce Masters students to the concepts and techniques involved in creating, managing and aggregating commercial sector products and cultural heritage object metadata, in the context of Linked Heritage Work Package 4.</p> <p>Website course: <a href="http://courses.uwe.ac.uk/gp5112/" title="Link to external website">http://courses.uwe.ac.uk/gp5112/</a></p> <p><strong>Participants:</strong> 16 masters students on the MSc ILM, plus the overall course leader (Paul Matthews), and Michael Hopwood (Linked Heritage) as the lecturer</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/91/moskow-workshop-u201cshare-culture-link-content-europeana-and-supporting-projectsu201d-at-the-xiii-annual-international-conference-u201ceva-2011-moscowu201d">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-06-10T13:35:31+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Moskow: Workshop %u201CShare culture, link content: Europeana and supporting projects%u201D at the XIII annual international conference %u201CEVA 2011 Moscow%u201D</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/91/moskow-workshop-u201cshare-culture-link-content-europeana-and-supporting-projectsu201d-at-the-xiii-annual-international-conference-u201ceva-2011-moscowu201d</link>         <description><p><strong>Goal:</strong> To promote Europeana and supporting projects, Linked Heritage, LIDO, as several Russian institutions were interested in participating in the project as well as harvesting their resources to Europeana through Linked Heritage services</p> <p><strong>Participants:</strong> museums, libraries, archives, educational institutions, IT in culture.</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/90/moskow-national-workshop-for-museums-archives-libraries-u201ca-road-to-europeana-or-how-to-participate-in-a-european-net-projectu201d">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-06-10T13:32:44+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Moskow: National Workshop for museums, archives, libraries %u201CA road to Europeana or how to participate in a European net project%u201D</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/90/moskow-national-workshop-for-museums-archives-libraries-u201ca-road-to-europeana-or-how-to-participate-in-a-european-net-projectu201d</link>         <description><p><strong>Goal:</strong> To promote the Linked Heritage project as a road to Europeana</p> <p><strong>Participants:</strong> Russian museums, archives, libraries</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/89/dublin-international-digitisation-conference-access-use-re-use-unlocking-the-potential-of-online-digital-cultural-content">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-05-06T17:45:44+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Dublin International Digitisation Conference "Access, Use, Re - Use: Unlocking the Potential of Online Digital Cultural Content"</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/89/dublin-international-digitisation-conference-access-use-re-use-unlocking-the-potential-of-online-digital-cultural-content</link>         <description><p>On the June 17th there will be the <strong>International EU Presidency Conference</strong> at Dublin Castle on <strong>&ldquo;Access, Use, Re-use &ndash; Unlocking the potential of online cultural content&rdquo;.</strong> (Please note registration for this event will be on the official <a href="http://eu2013.ie">Irish Presidency website</a>).</p> <p><img alt="Irish-Presidency-of-the-Council-of-the-EU" height="83" src="http://www.digitalmeetsculture.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/Irish-Presidency-of-the-Council-of-the-EU.jpg" width="235" /> This international conference will focus on developing new access to online cultural content to support education, cultural tourism, creative industries and to provide creative new ways for people to participate in their cultural heritage. Speakers will be drawn from leading international companies in the digital field and from leading experts in the EU research and cultural heritage area. All 27 member states will be represented through their Ministries of Culture or national authorities for libraries, museums and archives with additional attendance from key European institutions and associations and all of the main cultural institutions in Ireland, north and south. The conference is funded by the EU Competitiveness and Innovation Framework Programme Linked Heritage project.</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/88/dublin-linked-heritage-plenary-meeting-reserved-to-partners">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-05-06T17:24:24+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Dublin: Linked Heritage Plenary meeting (reserved to partners)</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/88/dublin-linked-heritage-plenary-meeting-reserved-to-partners</link>         <description><p>On the 17th June there will be the <strong>International EU Presidency Conference</strong>. The registration will be on the official Irish Presidency website.</p> <p>On the 18th June it is planned the <strong>Linked Heritage plenary meeting</strong> (reserved to Linked Heritage partners).</p> <p>The registration form is available at: <a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6490777089">http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6490777089</a>.</p> <p>Regarding accommodations here below you can find a list of suggestions.</p> <p><strong>Venue:</strong></p> <p>Local Government House, Ushers Quay, Dublin</p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Hotels</span></strong></p> <p>Conference rates at the following hotels adjacent to Dublin Castle, to be reserved by completing the attached hotel booking forms (by the 19 May to avail of the conference rates):</p> <p><strong>Morgan Hotel</strong>, (4*) 10-12 Fleet Street, Dublin 2. &nbsp;Phone: &nbsp;00353 (0)1 643 7000<br /> 16<sup></sup>, 17<sup></sup> and 18<sup></sup> June: &euro;150 single room and &euro;165 double room per night B&amp;B<a href="http://www.themorgan.com/"><br />http://www.themorgan.com/</a></p> <p><strong>Paramount Hotel</strong>, (3*) 7/8 Exchange Street Upper, Temple Bar, Dublin 2. Phone: &nbsp;00353 (0)1 4179900<br /> 16, 17<sup></sup> and 18<sup></sup> June: &euro;85.00 per room per night B&amp;B based on 2 people sharing or &euro;75.00 per room per night B&amp;B based on single occupancy<br /><a href="http://www.paramounthotel.ie/">http://www.paramounthotel.ie/</a></p> <p><strong>Harding Hotel</strong>, (3*) Fishamble St., Christchurch, Dublin 2. Phone: 00353 (0)1 679 6500<br /> 16 and 17<sup></sup> June: &euro;69.00 per room per night B&amp;B for single occupancy and &euro;90.00 per room per night B&amp;B for double occupancy<br /><a href="http://www.hardinghotel.ie/">http://www.hardinghotel.ie/</a></p> <p>Alternative hotels, maps and local information can be located via the Dublin Tourism website <a href="http://www.visitdublin.com/">http://www.visitdublin.com/</a></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/87/portland-usa-museums-and-the-web-2013">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-04-16T20:40:01+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Portland, USA: Museums and the Web 2013</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/87/portland-usa-museums-and-the-web-2013</link>         <description><p>MW2013 will host more than 200 presenters from more than 25 countries... <a href="http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/speakers-authors/">http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/speakers-authors/</a> updating you on the newest research and most exemplary applications of digital practice for cultural, natural and scientific heritage.<br /><br />Review the program <a href="http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/program/">http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/program/</a> and then join to interact with leading professionals from around the world:http://<a href="http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/registration/">mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/registration/</a> &nbsp;.<br /><br />If you cant attend you can order the products of our meetings and conversations &ndash; the MW proceedings, or review the Best of the Web archives an unparalleled resource for museum workers, technologists, students and researchers that grows every year. &nbsp;Pre-Order your copy of the proceedings here: <a href="http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/registration/">http://mw2013.museumsandtheweb.com/registration/</a><br /><br />All MW2013 Sessions will be held at The Portland Marriott Downtown Waterfront Hotel. The Hotel is located on the Willamette riverfront, walking distance from Portland State University and convenient to great dining, shopping, and museums.<br /><br />MW2013 has negotiated a special rate of $179 [single or double]. The &ldquo;cut-off date&rdquo; for accepting reservations in this guest room block is Tuesday, March 25, 2013. Reservation requests received after 5:00 p.m. local time at the Hotel on the cut-off date will be accepted at Hotel&rsquo;s prevailing rate, based on room type availability.<br /><br /></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/86/marseille-digitalheritage-2013">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-03-30T12:32:24+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Marseille: DigitalHeritage 2013</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/86/marseille-digitalheritage-2013</link>         <description><p>Fall 2013 will witness the largest international scientific event on digital heritage in history, bringing together hundreds of researchers, educators, scientists, industry professionals and policy makers to debate, discuss and present digital technology applied to the protection, documentation, and understanding of humanity&rsquo;s shared heritage. For the first time ever, under the patronage of UNESCO, the leading scientific and industry events from across the digital and heritage spheres will join together under one roof to explore the state-of-the-art and address future emerging research scenarios. Organized by CNRS (french National Center for Scientific Research) on behalf of the MAP Laboratory, in collaboration with local research institutions Provence (Aix-Marseille University, Arts et M&eacute;tiers ParisTech, CICRP, School of Architecture and INRIA), the Congress will be held in Marseille, France, the 2013 European Capital of Culture. The venue will be Marseille&rsquo;s architecturally stunning new waterfront museum complex (the restored Fort Saint-Jean and adjoining new MuCEM and La Villa Mediterran&eacute;e).</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/85/paris-seminar-on-multilingualism-and-terminology">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-03-25T13:54:14+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Paris: Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/85/paris-seminar-on-multilingualism-and-terminology</link>         <description><p><strong>Venue:</strong><br />Auditorium Colbert<br />Institut national d'histoire de l'art (INHA)<br /><a href="http://www.inha.fr">http://www.inha.fr</a><br />2 rue Vivienne<br />75002 Paris</p> <p>Multilingualism is crucial especially in a European context. Cultural institutions are dealing with thousands and thousands of digital content. European initiatives are developped in order to provide and promote the access to this digital cultural heritage which implicitely suggest a multilingual access to these collections. Cultural institutions are often using their own controlled vocabularies, thesaurus, classifications, ontologies or any kind of terminology. If European projects and initiatives are a way to bring together these different terminologiest, technologies of the Semantic Web (with interoperable format such as SKOS (Simplified Knowledge Organisation System) are a way to enable multlingualism and a first step towards Linked Data.</p> <p>The purpose of this seminar is to present national and European projects where the question of terminology and multilingualism is dealt with. Some projects create multilingual terminologies on very specific subjects, some others focus on the implementation of tools to create, manage and reuse these terminologies. The seminar will present one of the achievement of the Linked Heritage WP3 with the Terminology Management Platform (TMP) and will bring together other European and national initiatives creating and developping multilingual terminology resources or tools for managing or reusing them.</p> <p><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/5816995791/?ref=enivte001&amp;utm_source=eb_email&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=inviteformalv2&amp;utm_term=attend&amp;ref=enivte001" title="link to external website">Registration form</a> (before 8 April 2013)</p> <h3>Agenda</h3> <p>9h-9h30 Registration</p> <p>9h30 &ndash; 9h45<br /><strong>Welcome</strong><br />Claire Lamboley (Head of the Service for the Coordination of Cultural Policies and Innovation, MCC)</p> <p><strong>MULTILINGUALISM AND TERMINOLOGY: A EUROPEAN CHALLENGE</strong></p> <p>9h45 &ndash; 10h<br /><strong>Multilighualism in European projects</strong><br />Rossella Caffo (MIBAC) (<a href="media:468:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Caffo" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Caffo">PDF</a>, 603 kb)</p> <p>10h &ndash; 10h20<br /><strong>Multilingual terminology mapping in Europeana</strong><strong></strong><br />Vivien Petras (Humboldt University of Berlin) (<a href="media:473:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Petras" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Petras">PDF</a>, 3873 kb)</p> <p>10h20 &ndash; 10h40<br /><strong>Recommendations and Guidelines for terminology (ATHENA and Linked Heritage projects)</strong><br />Marie-V&eacute;ronique Leroi (MCC) and Eva Coudyzer (KMKG) (<a href="media:470:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Leroi - Coudyzer" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Leroi - Coudyzer">PDF</a>, 2116 kb) <br /><br />10h40 &ndash; 11h10 Coffee Break</p> <p><strong>TOOLS FOR CREATION, HARMONISATION AND MANAGEMENT OF MULTILINGUAL TERMINOLOGIES</strong></p> <p>11h10- 11h30</p> <p><strong>Terminology Management Platform (TMP) (Linked Heritage)</strong><br />Marie-V&eacute;ronique Leroi (MCC) and Florent Andr&eacute; (Universit&eacute; de Savoie) (<a href="media:471:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Leroi" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Leroi">PDF</a>, 803 kb)<br /><br />11h30-11h50<br /><strong>SIERA: a multilingual knowledge sharing project</strong> <br /> Christophe Roche (Universidade Nova de Lisboa - Faculdade de Ciencias Sociais e Humanas) (<a href="media:474:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Siera" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Siera">PDF</a>,</p> <p>11h50-12h15&nbsp; Questions &amp; discussion</p> <p>12h15- 13h30 Free time for lunch</p> <p>14h-14h20<br /><strong>GINCO: an open tool for vocabulary conception</strong><br />Katell Briatte (MCC)</p> <p>14h20 &ndash; 14h40<br /><strong>The publication and exploitation of knowledge structures with OpenSKOS </strong><br />Mark Linderman (Picturae Database publishing)</p> <p><strong>THESAURUS, CLASSIFICATIONS AND OTHER SPECIALISED AND MULTILINGUAL TERMINOLOGY RESOURCES</strong></p> <p>14h40 &ndash;15h<br /><strong>Multilingual thesaurus on Photography (Europeana Photography)</strong><br />Nacha Van Steen (KMKG) (<a href="media:475:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Van Steen" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Van Steen">PDF</a>, 176 kb)</p> <p>15h &ndash; 15h20<br /><strong>Multilingual thesaurus on music instruments (MIMO)</strong> <br />Rodolphe Bailly (Cit&eacute; de la musique) (<a href="media:467:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Bailly" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Bailly">PDF</a>, 2230 kb)</p> <p>15h20 &ndash; 15h40<br /><strong>PARTAGE PLUS: Controlled vocabulary for the enrichment of international metadata enabling Art nouveau in Europeana</strong> <br />Christiane Pagel (Fotomarburg) (<a href="media:472:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Pagel" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Pagel">PDF</a>, 1866 kb)</p> <p>15h40 &ndash;16h10 : Coffee Break</p> <p><strong>LINKED DATA : REUSE AND APPLICATIONS</strong></p> <p>16h10-16h30</p> <p><strong>SemanticP&eacute;dia: Cultural and semantic issues around the web data</strong><br />Thibaut Grouas (MCC) (<a href="media:469:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Grouas" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Grouas">PDF</a>, 382 kb)</p> <p>16h30 &ndash;16h50<br /><strong>Using VIAF in data.bnf.fr: creating links to import information</strong><br />Romain Wenz (Bnf) (<a href="media:476:Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Wenz" title="Seminar on Multilingualism and Terminology, Paris, 18 April 2013: Wenz">PDF</a>, 1709 kb)</p> <p>16h50 -17h30 : Questions, Open discussion and conclusion of the day</p> <p>All videos are available on the MICHAEL Association website at: <a href="http://www.michael-culture.eu/blog/seminar-multilingualism-and-terminology-paris-18-04-2013.html">http://www.michael-culture.eu/blog/seminar-multilingualism-and-terminology-paris-18-04-2013.html</a>, or on VIMEO at:&nbsp;<a href="https://vimeo.com/user14659022">https://vimeo.com/user14659022</a></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/84/london-open-culture-2013">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-03-09T08:27:53+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>London: Open Culture 2013</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/84/london-open-culture-2013</link>         <description><p>Annual event organised by Collections that focuses on collections management called OpenCulture. The two day conference is also supported by a trade fare packed with leading suppliers of products and services for all those directing, managing and running museums, archives, galleries, and specialist libraries and their collections.</p> <p>The conference website at <a href="http://www.openculture2013.org.uk">www.openculture2013.org.uk</a> contains all the latest details, the <a href="http://www.collectionslink.org.uk/openculture2013-delegates-programme">programme</a>, the list of expert <a href="http://www.collectionslink.org.uk/openculture2013-delegates-speakers">speakers</a>.</p> <p>This year, the theme of the conference is &ldquo;<em>How can Collections Management power the Participatory Museum of tomorrow?</em>&rdquo; and in particular, there is a strong focus on digital issues, including how the Smithsonian Institution is addressing its digital strategy and a panel session on <em>The Digital Transformation</em>.&nbsp;</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/83/tartu-conference-on-copyright-issues-related-to-digitisation-in-libraries">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-02-05T19:38:29+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Tartu: Conference on copyright issues related to digitisation in libraries</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/83/tartu-conference-on-copyright-issues-related-to-digitisation-in-libraries</link>         <description><p><strong>On 6-7 June 2013 the international conference &ldquo;To Digitise or not to Digitise: Copyright, Public Domain, Orphan Works and Other Issues&rdquo; will take place in the University of Tartu Library, Estonia. An open eBooks on Demand (EOD) network meeting will also be held.<br /><br /></strong>The conference explores the ways how libraries could confidently make decisions about materials to be digitised, based on current and future legislation, and thus meet the users&rsquo; needs in maximum.<br /><br />The speakers at the conference are:</p> <p><strong>Dr. Harald M&uuml;ller</strong>, Max Planck Institute for Comparative Public Law and International Law: &ldquo;Orphan works &ndash; the new EC directive and its implementation&rdquo;</p> <p><strong>Dr. Que Anh Ha</strong>, University of Innsbruck: ARROW+</p> <p><strong>Patrick Peiffer</strong>, National Library of Luxembourg: Public Domain Calculator</p> <p><strong>Dr. Rainer Kuhlen</strong>, ENCES: "Knowledge ecology and knowledge economy interests can be made compatible"</p> <p><strong>Dr. Gudrun Wirtz</strong>, Bavarian State Library: &ldquo;Between legal restrictions, technological possiblities and user needs &ndash; the acquisition strategy of German Open Access Repository for East European Studies &ldquo;OstDok&rdquo;</p> <p><strong>Dr. Aleksei Kelli</strong>, University of Tartu: &ldquo;The authorial rights in the digital economy&rdquo;</p> <p><strong>Karmen Linask</strong>, National Library of Estonia: &ldquo;Digital collections and legal challenges in Estonia&rdquo;</p> <p><strong>Jerker Ryden</strong>, National Library of Sweden: &ldquo;Interlibrary loan in the future &ndash; how to fix the digital link?&rdquo;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>The conference targets libraries, archives, museums and other interested parties who deal with copyright matters or are interested in providing the EOD digitisation service on demand.<br /><br /><strong>Participation is free, but registration </strong>via the<strong> </strong>conference website is required latest by <strong>15</strong> <strong>May, 2013</strong>: <a href="http://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.utlib.ee/eod2013/registration&amp;sa=D&amp;sntz=1&amp;usg=AFQjCNEbLR_0_AgFB98bw1yzE2Cgq7JfKw">http://www.utlib.ee/eod2013/registration</a>. <br /><br />For more information please visit:<br />the conference website <a href="http://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.utlib.ee/eod2013/&amp;sa=D&amp;sntz=1&amp;usg=AFQjCNFXdwAYaNJRJvT2BLBuTTpPbKJ3pQ">http://www.utlib.ee/eod2013</a> <br />EOD website: <a href="http://www.google.com/url?q=http://books2ebooks.eu/&amp;sa=D&amp;sntz=1&amp;usg=AFQjCNGE6fXwNNDRjOIzhmvXTnUHUdC-JA">http://books2ebooks.eu</a><br /><br />The conference is organised by the coordinator of the EOD network, University of Innsbruck Library, and University of Tartu Library.<br /><br /><strong>Additional information</strong></p> <p>Silvia Gstrein, coordinator of the EOD network, University of Innsbruck, Library, <a href="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/h/1ouui9qyt401j/?&amp;v=b&amp;cs=wh&amp;to=silvia.gstrein@uibk.ac.at">silvia.gstrein@uibk.ac.at</a>, <a href="tel:++43 (0)512&Acirc;&nbsp;507 8451">++43 (0)512&nbsp;507 8451</a>;<br />Liisi Lembinen, University of Tartu Library, <a href="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/h/1ouui9qyt401j/?&amp;v=b&amp;cs=wh&amp;to=liisi.lembinen@ut.ee">liisi.lembinen@ut.ee</a>, <a href="tel:+ 372 737 5700">+ 372 737 5700</a>;<br />Elena Sipria-Mironov, University of Tartu Library, <a href="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/h/1ouui9qyt401j/?&amp;v=b&amp;cs=wh&amp;to=elena.sipria-mironov@ut.ee">elena.sipria-mironov@ut.ee</a>, <a href="tel:+372 737 5750">+372 737 5750</a>.<br /><br />&Otilde;nne Mets, Activity Leader of the EOD dissemination; National Library of Estonia, <a href="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/h/1ouui9qyt401j/?&amp;v=b&amp;cs=wh&amp;to=mets@nlib.ee">mets@nlib.ee</a></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/82/padova-il-patrimonio-culturale-digitale-verso-europeana-e-culturaitalia-aspetti-tecnici-e-metodologia">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-01-28T16:48:10+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Padova: Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia: aspetti tecnici e metodologia</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/82/padova-il-patrimonio-culturale-digitale-verso-europeana-e-culturaitalia-aspetti-tecnici-e-metodologia</link>         <description><table border="0"> <tbody> <tr> <td><img alt="Logo Universit&agrave; di Padova" src="getImage.php?id=422&amp;w=101&amp;h=100" style="width: 101px; height: 100px;" title="Logo Universit&agrave; di Padova" /></td> <td><img alt="Linked Heritage - LOGO" src="getImage.php?id=100&amp;w=168&amp;h=101" style="width: 168px; height: 101px;" title="Linked Heritage - LOGO" /></td> <td>&nbsp;<img alt="Logo Commissione europea" src="getImage.php?id=423&amp;w=135&amp;h=100" style="width: 135px; height: 100px;" title="Logo Commissione europea" /></td> <td><img alt="Logo ICCU" src="getImage.php?id=424&amp;w=52&amp;h=100" style="width: 52px; height: 100px;" title="Logo ICCU" /></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p align="left">&nbsp;</p> <p align="left"><strong>Sede dell'evento: <br /></strong>Universit&agrave; degli Studi di Padova, Palazzo Bo<br />Sala Archivio antico<br />via 8 febbraio 2</p> <!--<p>CEDOLA DI REGISTRAZIONE:<a href="../index.php?en/198/regsitration-form-lh-workshop-nazionale-padova-6-marzo-2013"><br />http://www.linkedheritage.org/index.php?en/198/regsitration-form-lh-workshop-nazionale-padova-6-marzo-2013</a></p>--> <p align="left"><br />Il workshop illustra i temi principali affrontati dal progetto Linked Heritage in relazione all'aggregazione di contenuti per Europeana, il portale europeo della cultura - interoperabilit&agrave;, flusso di lavoro, dati aperti, multilinguismo, e-learning - e l'esperienza di CulturaItalia come aggregatore nazionale. Si rivolge a bibliotecari, curatori museali, archivisti ed esperti del settore culturale.</p> <h3>PROGRAMMA</h3> <p align="left"></p> <p>H 09:15-09:30 <br />Laura Tallandini (Delegato del Rettore per il Sistema Bibliotecario di Ateneo, Universit&agrave; di Padova)<br /><em>Introduzione e apertura dei lavori</em></p> <p>H 09:30-10:00<br />Rossella Caffo (direttore dell'Istituto centrale per il catalogo unico delle biblioteche)<em><br />Linked Heritage, Europeana e le altre iniziative europee e nazionali dell'ICCU </em>(<a href="media:447:Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Caffo" title="Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Caffo">PDF</a><em>, </em>6099 kb)<em><br /></em></p> <p>H 10:00-10:30<br />Marzia Piccininno (Istituto centrale per il catalogo unico delle biblioteche, progetto Linked Heritage)<em><br />Aggregare contenuti per Europeana: aspetti tecnici e procedurali </em>(<a href="media:449:Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Piccininno" title="Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Piccininno">PDF</a><em>, 2736 kb)<br /></em></p> <p>Coffee break</p> <p>H 10:45-11:15<br />Sara Di Giorgio (Istituto centrale per il catalogo unico delle biblioteche, CulturaItalia)<em><br />CulturaItalia e i Linked Open Data </em>(<a href="media:448:Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Di Giorgio" title="Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Di Giorgio">PDF</a>, 1204 kb)<em><br /></em></p> <p>H 11:15-11:45<br />Antonella Zane (Centro di Ateneo per le Biblioteche, Universit&agrave; di Padova)<em><br />I learning object di Linked Heritage </em>(<a href="media:452:Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Zane" title="Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Zane">PDF</a>, 7262 kb)<em><br /></em></p> <p>H 11:45-12:15</p> <p>Maria Teresa Natale (Istituto centrale per il catalogo unico delle biblioteche, progetto Linked Heritage)<em><br />Gestire le terminologie multilingue per un miglior accesso alla rete </em>(<a href="media:450:Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Natale" title="Il patrimonio culturale digitale verso Europeana e CulturaItalia, Padova, 6 marzo 2013: Natale">PDF</a>,&nbsp; 1247 kb)<em><br /></em></p> <p>H 12:15-13:00<br />Discussione libera</p> <p>H 13.00-14:15 Buffet Lunch</p> <p>--------</p> <p>ore 13:30-15:30&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>I learning object di Linked Heritage: laboratorio</strong><br />Emeroteca di Ca' Borin, Via del Santo, 22</p> <p>Il Laboratorio sar&agrave; centrato sul percorso formativo a distanza che si sta realizzando su temi chiave quali per esempio: perch&eacute; e come partecipare a Europeana, metadati e mappature, linked data e terminologie, il ciclo di vita della digitalizzazione e gli identificatori persistenti.<br /><br />Ogni partecipante sar&agrave; invitato a esplorare i risultati fin qui raggiunti (piattaforma elearning, Learning objects e contenuti) e a compilare i questionari di valutazione predisposti.</p> <p align="left">&nbsp;</p> <!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>     </xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 10]> <style>  /* Style Definitions */  table.MsoNormalTable  {mso-style-name:"Tabella normale";  mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;  mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;  mso-style-noshow:yes;  mso-style-parent:"";  mso-padding-alt:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt;  mso-para-margin:0cm;  mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;  mso-pagination:widow-orphan;  font-size:10.0pt;  font-family:"Times New Roman";  mso-ansi-language:#0400;  mso-fareast-language:#0400;  mso-bidi-language:#0400;} </style> <![endif]--></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/81/padova-linked-heritage-fifth-plenary-meeting-and-wp-technical-meetings-reserved-to-partners">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2013-01-23T08:59:18+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Padova: Linked Heritage Fifth Plenary Meeting and WP Technical meetings (Reserved to partners)</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/81/padova-linked-heritage-fifth-plenary-meeting-and-wp-technical-meetings-reserved-to-partners</link>         <description><p><strong>Venue:</strong> <br />University of Padua &ndash; Emeroteca Ca Borin Via del Santo 22</p> <h3><strong>PRELIMINARY PROGRAMME<br /></strong></h3> <h3><strong>Wednesday 6 March</strong></h3> <p><strong> </strong>10:00-13:00: Training on MINT for LH content providers<br />14:00-17:00: WP7 Training on Lods</p> <h3><strong>Thurday 7 March</strong></h3> <p><strong>9:30-13:00 Working group meetings<br /></strong></p> <ul> <li>9:30-10:45 WP7 meeting</li> <li>Coffe break</li> <li>11:15-13:00: WP4 meeting</li> </ul> <p>13:00 Buffet Lunch</p> <p><strong>14:00-17:45 Plenary meeting (First part)</strong></p> <p>18.00 Guide Tour to Teatro Anatomico and Cattedra di Galileo (registration requested) <br />20.30 Social Dinner (registration, each participants pays for himself)</p> <h3>Friday 8 March&nbsp;</h3> <p><strong>9:00-13:00 Plenary meeting (Second part)</strong></p> <p><strong>14:00-17:00 Working group meetings</strong></p> <ul> <li>WP3 meeting</li> </ul> <h3><strong>REGISTRATION (RESERVED TO LINKED HERITAGE PARTNERS)</strong></h3> <p>It is now possible to register to Linked Heritage plenary meeting, WG meetings, training workshops and social events which are planned in Padua on March 6th to 8th 2013.<br /> <br /> The registration form is available at: <a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/5317685340">www.eventbrite.com/event/5317685340</a>. Please, make separate registrations for all the people who are coming for your organisation.</p> <h3><strong>USEFUL INFORMATION</strong></h3> <h4><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>     Normal   0   14         false   false   false                             MicrosoftInternetExplorer4   </xml><![endif]--><strong>How to reach Padova</strong></h4> <p><strong>By AIR</strong></p> <p>The nearest airport is the "Marco Polo" airport in Venice, 20 kilometers (12 miles) east&nbsp; from Padova.&nbsp;</p> <p>Other airports: Treviso (62 Km), Verona (86 km), Bologna (120 km)</p> <p>The best way to go to Padova from Venezia airport is by <strong>bus</strong> (1 hour). You can take a <a href="http://www.fsbusitalia.it/cms-file/allegati/fsbusitalia/Volantino Montegrotto - Aeroporto web.pdf"><strong>FSBUSITALIA</strong></a> bus (blue buses). Tickets can be purchased in the Arrivals Hall, at the ATVO booth (cost&nbsp; 8.50 euros). The tickets can also be bought on board bus (10 &nbsp;euros). Exit the Arrivals Hall and turn right. You must get off at the bus station in Padova.</p> <p>Note that the taxi rank is in front of the railway station, 2 minute walk from the bus station .</p> <p>You can also take a bus to Venezia-Mestre and there take a <strong>train</strong> to Padova. From Venezia airport you have to take an <a href="http://www.actv.it/ifyouarriveatmarcopoloairport"><strong>ACTV bus</strong></a> (orange buses) or <a href="http://www.atvo.it/index.php?lang=en&amp;area=23&amp;menuid=35"><strong>ATVO FLYBUS bus</strong></a> and get off at the Venezia-Mestre railway station. &nbsp;You can buy tickets at the automatic ticket machines.</p> <p>All the <strong>trains</strong> going from Venezia-Mestre to Milano, Bologna&nbsp; or Roma, plus several local trains, stop in Padova. For info check the Italian Railway Web pages (<a href="http://www.trenitalia.com/">Trenitalia</a>).</p> <p>From Venice Marco Polo Airport you can also reach Padova by a <strong>shuttle service</strong>. That is more expensive, but will leave you exactly at your hotel. You can choose two different companies (reserve a seat at least 24 hours in advance):</p> <p>AIRSERVICE:<br />e-mail: airservice@taxipadova.it<br />tel.: +39-049-8707840<br />FAX: +39-049-8705050<br />Fare: at most 31 euros (depending on the number of people travelling)</p> <p>LANDOMAS:<br />e-mail: landomas@landomas.it<br />tel.: +39-049-8601426<br />fax: +39-049-8601642<br />Fare: at most 30 euros (the price can be lower, depending on the number of people travelling)</p> <h4><strong>How to reach the venue</strong></h4> <p>The Training workshops (MINT and VLE/LOs), the Plenary and the <br /> WGs technical meetings will be held at the: <br /> <em>Emeroteca di Ca' Borin,</em><br />Via del Santo, 22 - 35123 Padova</p> <p>Itinerary: <a href="http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?msid=212992545759562652936.000494385e181b42c9187&amp;msa=0">http://maps.google.co.uk/maps/ms?msid=212992545759562652936.000494385e181b42c9187&amp;msa=0</a></p> <p>From the railway or bus &nbsp;station: get on the TRAM (direction CAPOLINEA SUD Guizza) and get off at "Ponti romani" . Walk towards Via San Francesco -&gt; Via del Santo (about 5 minutes) .</p> <h4><strong>Other useful information</strong></h4> <p align="left"><strong>Selected hotels</strong></p> <p align="left"><em>Closest hotels to the meeting place</em>:</p> <ul> <li>Majestic Toscanelli Palace<a href="http://www.toscanelli.com/index.php"><br />http://www.toscanelli.com/index.php</a></li> <li>Hotel Giotto<a href="http://www.hotelgiotto.com/"><br />http://www.hotelgiotto.com/</a></li> <li>Belludi 37<br /><a href="http://www.belludi37.it/it/">http://www.belludi37.it/it/</a></li> <li>Albergo Verdi<a href="http://www.albergoverdipadova.it/"><br />http://www.albergoverdipadova.it/</a></li> <li>Hotel Al Santo<a href="http://www.alsanto.it/"><br />http://www.alsanto.it/</a></li> <li>Hotel M14<a href="http://www.hotelm14.it/home/"><br />http://www.hotelm14.it/home/</a></li> <li>Casa del Pellegrino<a href="http://www.casadelpellegrino.com/"><br <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-10-17T19:40:32+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Jasn\ufffd: Libraries 2015-2030: 6th annual Digital Library workshop</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/80/jasn-libraries-2015-2030-6th-annual-digital-library-workshop</link>         <description><p>Libraries stand or fall by their catalogs and the only real change from the past has been computerization. How are libraries in the coming years and decades to evolve? Do they have the potential to survive? Is the existence of the services and the physical space of libraries really irreplaceable? Who is the librarian of the future? etc.</p><p>Agenda: <!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>     Normal   0   14         false   false   false                             MicrosoftInternetExplorer4   </xml><![endif]--><a href="http://www.schk.sk/en/digilib/2012/agenda/">http://www.schk.sk/en/digilib/2012/agenda/</a></p><p><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>     </xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 10]> <style>  /* Style Definitions */  table.MsoNormalTable  {mso-style-name:"Tabella normale";  mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;  mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;  mso-style-noshow:yes;  mso-style-parent:"";  mso-padding-alt:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt;  mso-para-margin:0cm;  mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;  mso-pagination:widow-orphan;  font-size:10.0pt;  font-family:"Times New Roman";  mso-ansi-language:#0400;  mso-fareast-language:#0400;  mso-bidi-language:#0400;} </style> <![endif]-->    </p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/79/lucca-lubec-2012">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-10-17T08:01:43+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Lucca: Lu.Be.C 2012</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/79/lucca-lubec-2012</link>         <description><p><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>     Normal   0   14         false   false   false                             MicrosoftInternetExplorer4   </xml><![endif]-->Organised by Promo P.A. Fondazione, Lu.Be.C. - Lucca Beni Culturali - is the international meeting dedicated to the knowledge and development of cultural heritage - technology - tourism, which takes place every year in Lucca, in the third week of October. These two days alternate plenary sessions, debates, workshops, presentations and previews to propose and implement data analysis, researches, business models and best practices, of proficient strategies and collaborative networks, through a constant new organisation addressed to stimulate debates and exchange innovative ideas.    </p><p>Programme:<br /><a href="http://www.lubec.it/convegno/lubec-2012.html" title="Link to external website">http://www.lubec.it/convegno/lubec-2012.html</a> </p><p>&nbsp;</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/78/lisbon-linked-heritage-fourth-plenary-meeting-and-wp-technical-meetings-reserved-to-partners">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-10-03T15:29:15+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Lisbon: Linked Heritage Fourth Plenary Meeting and WP Technical meetings (Reserved to partners)</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/78/lisbon-linked-heritage-fourth-plenary-meeting-and-wp-technical-meetings-reserved-to-partners</link>         <description><p><strong>Venue:</strong> <br />IST - Instituto Superior T&eacute;cnico - <a href="http://www.ist.utl.pt/en/">http://www.ist.utl.pt/en/</a><br /> (The IST has two campi, Alameda and TagusPark; the meeting will be at Alameda, in central Lisbon)<br /> Address: &nbsp;Av. Rovisco Pais, 1, 1049-001 Lisboa - Portugal </p><p><strong>Preliminary Programme</strong></p><p><strong>Thursday 29/11<br />       </strong>09:00-11:00: WP2 meeting<br />       11:00-13:00: WP3 meeting + WP4 meeting (parallel sessions)<br />       13:00-14:00 buffet lunch<br />       14:00-18:00 plenary meeting (part I)<br />       evening: social dinner<br />       <strong><br />         Friday 30/11<br />       </strong>9:00-12:00 plenary meeting (part II)<br />       12:00-13:30 WP7 meeting<br />       14:30: guided tour    <br /><br /> How to reach the IST: <a href="http://www.ist.utl.pt/en/about-IST/location/">http://www.ist.utl.pt/en/about-IST/location/</a><br /> <br /> At the IST, the meeting place will be the Congress Center (&quot;Centro de Congressos&quot;) in the building &quot;Civil&quot; (the building of the civil engineering department). The campus is not too big, so it is not complicated to find...<br /> <br /> Public transports are very convenient, as the campus is in a central area,<br /> <br /> The closest hotels are:<br /> <a href="http://www.holidayinn.com/hotels/us/en/lisbon/lispo/hoteldetail">http://www.holidayinn.com/hotels/us/en/lisbon/lispo/hoteldetail</a><br /> <a href="http://www.hotelturimlisboa.com/">http://www.hotelturimlisboa.com/</a><br /> <a href="http://www.alifhotels.com/Hotel-Campo-Pequeno-Lisbon.aspx">http://www.alifhotels.com/Hotel-Campo-Pequeno-Lisbon.aspx</a></p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/77/cyprus-international-workshop-on-supporting-users-exploration-of-digital-libraries-suedl">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-09-17T21:52:46+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/</dc:source>         <title>Cyprus: International Workshop on Supporting Users' Exploration of Digital Libraries (SUEDL)</title>         <link>http://www.linkedheritage.eu/index.php?en/146/events/77/cyprus-international-workshop-on-supporting-users-exploration-of-digital-libraries-suedl</link>         <description>The International Workshop on Supporting Users&#39; Exploration of Digital Libraries (SUEDL) is held as part of the International Conference on Theory and Practice of Digital Libraries (TPDL)<br /> <br /> The aim of the workshop is to stimulate collaboration from experts and  stakeholders in Digital Libraries, Cultural Heritage, Natural Language  Processing and Information Retrieval in order to explore methods and  strategies to support exploration of Digital Libraries, beyond the white  box paradigm of search and click.<br /> <br /> PROGRAM<br /> <br /> <a href="http://ixa2.si.ehu.es/suedl/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=53&amp;Itemid=63">http://ixa2.si.ehu.es/suedl/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=53&amp;Itemid=63</a></description>     </item> </rdf:RDF>
